title-group.article-title: Unguizetes (Knorozovia) ershovae (Acari, Oribatida, Mochlozetidae), a new oribatid mite subgenus and species from Mexico

kwd.tp:taxon-name: Unguizetes ( Calugarella ) Balogh and P. Balogh, 1992

sec.title: N/A
sec.p:
Unguizetes ( Knorozovia ) ershovae
( Acari , Oribatida , Mochlozetidae ), a new oribatid mite subgenus and species from Mexico

Sergey G. Ermilov K a
,
Andrey A. Yurtaev K a a Tyumen State University, Institute of Environmental and Agricultural Biology (X-BIO), Tyumen , Russia .
Original research

sec.title: ABSTRACT
sec.p:
A new oribatid mite subgenus of the genus
Unguizetes
( Oribatida , Mochlozetidae )‚Äî U. ( Knorozovia ) n. subgen. , with
U. ( K. ) ershovae
n. sp.
as type species‚Äîis described, based on material collected from Mexico . It can be distinguished from the nominate subgenus by the number of notogastral setal alveoli (14 pairs versus 10 pairs) and well-developed dorsosejugal suture. An identification key to the known supraspecies taxa within Mochlozetidae is provided.

sec.title: N/A
sec.p: Keywords mochlozetid mites Õæ taxonomy Õæ morphology Õæ identification key Õæ Neotropical region

Zoobank http://zoobank.org/
7D3FB050-7F63-4EAB-9279-84166B14DC0D

sec.title: Introduction
sec.p:
The oribatid mite family Mochlozetidae ( Acari , Oribatida ) comprises 13 supraspecies taxa (11 genera and two subgenera) with 79 species having a cosmopolitan distribution collectively. Many representatives of the family are arboreal but some species are registered in soil-litter (e.g.,
,
Õæ
,
).

Unguizetes Sellnick, 1925
, with type species
Oribata sphaerula Berlese, 1905
, is the largest genus of Mochlozetidae . Its taxonomic revision has been presented by
. During faunistic study of oribatid mites collected from Mexico , we found a new species belonging to the new subgenus of
Unguizetes
. The main goal of our paper is to describe
Unguizetes

sec.title:
( Knorozovia ) n. subgen. , with
U. ( K. ) ershovae
n. sp as type species, based on adults.
sec.p:
Also, we present an identification key to the known genera/subgenera of Mochlozetidae using morphological traits and supraspecies system mostly from the systematic and revision taxonomic papers (e.g.,
,
Õæ
,
Õæ

2009Õæ
Õæ
Õæ
Õæ
).

Presently, five Mochlozetidae genera were found in Mexico (
Õæ
):
Dynatozetes Grandjean, 1960
Õæ
Mahunkazetes Balogh and Balogh, 1992
Õæ
Mochloribatula Mahunka, 1978
Õæ
Mochlozetes Grandjean, 1930
Õæ and
Uracrobates Balogh and Mahunka, 1967
.

sec.title: Methods
sec.p: Observation and documentation

For measurement and illustration, specimens were mounted in lactic acid on temporary cavity slides. All measurements are in micrometers. Body length was measured in lateral view, from the tip of the rostrum to the posterior edge of the notogasterÕæ other structures we oriented to avoid parallax errors. Notogastral width refers to the maximum of the ventral plate in ventral aspect and on level of the pteromorphs in dorsal aspect. Setal lengths were measured perpendicular to their long axis, accounting for curvature. Formulas for leg solenidia are given in square brackets according to the sequence genu-tibia-tarsus. Drawings were made with a camera lucida using a Leica DM 2500 transmission light microscope. For SEM microscopy alcohol preserved mites were dusted with silver and scanned with the aid of a JEOL‚ÄìJSM-6510LV SEM microscope.
Terminology

Morphological terminology used in this paper follows that of Grandjean (
,
),
,
),
, 2017)Õæ also
for leg setal nomenclature and
for overview are used.
Abbreviations
Prodorsum: lam = lamellaÕæ tlam = translamellaÕæ slam = sublamellaÕæ Al = sublamellar porose areaÕæ

tu = tutoriumÕæ ro , le , in , bs , ex = rostral, lamellar, interlamellar, bothridial, and exobothridial setae, respectivelyÕæ D = dorsophragma. Notogaster: c , da , la , dm , lm , dp , lp , h , p = notogastral setaeÕæ Aa , A1 , A2 , A3 = porose areasÕæ ia , im , ip , ih , ips = lyrifissuresÕæ gla = opisthonotal gland opening. Gnathosoma: a , m , h = subcapitular setaeÕæ or = adoral setaÕæ d , l , cm , acm , ul , su , lt , vt , inf , sup = palp setaeÕæ œâ = palp solenidionÕæ cha , chb = cheliceral setaeÕæ Tg = Tr√§g√•rdh‚Äôs organ. Epimeral and lateral podosomal regions: 1a , 1b , 1c , 2a , 3a , 3b , 3c , 4a , 4b , 4c = epimeral setaeÕæ Am , Ah = humeral porose areasÕæ PdI , PdII = pedotecta I, II, respectivelyÕæ cus = custodiumÕæ dis = discidiumÕæ cir = circumpedal carinaÕæ z = aperture of supracoxal gland. Anogenital region: g , ag , an , ad = genital, aggenital, anal, and adanal setae, respectivelyÕæ iad = adanal lyrifissureÕæ po = preanal organ. Legs: Tr , Fe , Ge , Ti , Ta = trochanter, femur, genu, tibia, and tarsus, respectivelyÕæ pa = porose areaÕæ œâ, œÉ, œÜ = solenidiaÕæ …õ = famulusÕæ d , l , v , ev , bv , ft , tc , it , p , u , a , s , pv , pl = setae.

mixed-citation.named-content: Unguizetes (Knorozovia) ershovae (Acari, Oribatida, Mochlozetidae), a new oribatid mite subgenus and species from Mexico

tp:treatment-sec.p:
Type species:
Oribata sphaerula Berlese, 1905
, by original designation, p. 171

mixed-citation.named-content: Unguizetes (Knorozovia) ershovae (Acari, Oribatida, Mochlozetidae), a new oribatid mite subgenus and species from Mexico

tp:treatment-sec.p:
Type species:
Unguizetes ( Knorozovia ) ershovae
n. sp.

Adult ‚Äî With character states of
Unguizetes
(see Ermilov 2016 ) but with 14 pairs of notogastral setal alveoli and well developed, complete dorsosejugal suture.

Remarks ‚Äî The new subgenus is similar to the nominate subgenus in many morphological traits, but differs from the latter by the subgeneric traits (14 pairs of notogastral setal alveoliÕæ dorsosejugal suture strong, complete versus 10 pairs of notogastral setal alveoliÕæ dorsosejugal suture interrupted or indistinct medially).

Also, the new subgenus is similar to
Gephyrazetes ( Gephyrazetes )
Hirauchi, 1999
in the presence of 14 pairs of notogastral setae and complete dorsosejugal suture, but differs from the latter by the notogastral setae represented by alveoli (versus setae medium-sized, setiform), the localization of notogastral porose area
A 1
in dorsomedial position (versus
A 1
in lateroperipheral position), long tutorium (versus short), and in having six pairs of genital setae (versus four or five pairs).

sec.title: Etymology ‚Äî The subgenus is named after Yuri Valentinovich Knorozov (1922‚Äì1999),
sec.p: a brilliant Russian scholar in the American studies, who deciphered the Mayan hieroglyphic writing in the middle of the 20th century. Knorozov was a historian, ethnographer, linguist, a staunch supporter of systemic and interdisciplinary research, the creator of the theory of ethnic semiotics and the theory of communication as the basis of collective activity. He repeatedly visited Guatemala and Yucatan, studying the culture and the origin of Native American languages, especially the Mayan. In addition, the zoo environment, which is an important part of the ethno-cultural context, has always been a special interest of Yu. V . Knorozov.

mixed-citation.named-content: Unguizetes (Knorozovia) ershovae (Acari, Oribatida, Mochlozetidae), a new oribatid mite subgenus and species from Mexico

tp:taxon-treatment.tp:mixed-nomenclature:
Unguizetes ( Knorozovia ) ershovae
n. sp.
Zoobank: DA26D698-E8B0-4FE5-AAE3-8669ED54D294

tp:treatment-sec.p:
Material examined ‚Äî
Holotype (female) and five paratypes ( three males and two females ): Mexico , 20¬∞41‚Ä≤N , 87¬∞03‚Ä≤W , Quintana Roo,
Municipio de Solidaridad
, vicinities of Playa del Carmen , leaf litter under trees and bushes in secondary semi-evergreen tropical forest (date and collector unknownÕæ collection of the Tyumen State University Museum of Zoology , Tyumen , Russia Õæ
Gashev et al. 2005
).

Type deposition ‚Äî The holotype is deposited in the collection of the Senckenberg Museum of Natural History, G√∂rlitz, Germany Õæ five paratypes are deposited in the collection of the Tyumen State University Museum of Zoology, Tyumen , Russia . All specimens are preserved in 70% solution of ethanol with a drop of glycerol.

Diagnosis ‚Äî Body length: 585‚Äì690. Notogaster distinctly striate, partially forming reticulate ornamentation. Cusp of lamella with lateral toothÕæ translamella straight, comparatively broadÕæ tutorium without cusp, directed to insertion of rostral seta. Rostral, lamellar and interlamellar setae long, setiform, barbedÕæ ro shortest, in longestÕæ bothridial seta long, with slightly developed, fusiform, barbed head. Dorsosejugal suture undulate. Pteromorph well developed. Notogastral porose areas roundedÕæ A1 and A2 located close to each other. Fourteen pairs of notogastral setae as alveoli. Palp setae lt‚Ä≤ , lt‚Ä≥ , vt‚Ä≤ , vt‚Ä≥ on tarsus and l‚Ä≤ , l‚Ä≥ on genu short. Custodium long, narrowly triangular. Discidium broadly triangular. Epimeral, genital and aggenital setae medium-sized to comparatively short, setiform, slightly barbedÕæ anal and adanal setae minute, setiform, roughened. Adanal lyrifissure located close and slightly diagonal to anal plate.
Description of adult ‚Äî Measurements ‚Äì Body length: 690 ( holotype ), 585, 600, 630

Prodorsum (
,
,
) ‚Äì Rostrum broadly rounded. Lamella (including cusp) about 1/2 length of prodorsum, with short cusp having distinct lateral toothÕæ translamella straight, comparatively broadÕæ tutorium about 1/2 length of prodorsum, lamelliform, without cusp. Sublamellar porose area oval (9‚Äì11 √ó 6‚Äì7). Rostral (75‚Äì82), lamellar (120‚Äì127) and interlamellar (165‚Äì176) setae setiform, barbedÕæ ro inserted on tutorial endÕæ bothridial seta (109‚Äì116) with long stalk and short, slightly developed, fusiform, barbed headÕæ exobothridial seta (37‚Äì45) setiform, thin, barbed. Dorsosejugal porose area not observed.

Notogaster (
,
,
) ‚Äì Dorsosejugal suture strong, undulate. Pteromorph broadly rounded laterally. Four pairs of rounded porose areas (11‚Äì15)Õæ A1 and A2 located comparatively close to each other, both in lateral position but A1 anteromedial to A2 . Fourteen pairs of notogastral setae represented by alveoli. Opisthonotal gland opening and all lyrifissures distinct.

Gnathosoma (
) ‚Äì Subcapitulum size: 150‚Äì161 √ó 97‚Äì101Õæ subcapitular ( a , h :
22‚Äì26Õæ m : 41‚Äì49) and adoral (11) setae setiform, thin, barbed. Palp length: 116‚Äì120Õæ setation:
roughened. Chelicera length: 172‚Äì187Õæ setae ( cha : 52‚Äì56Õæ chb : 32‚Äì34) setiform, barbed.

Anogenital region (
) ‚Äì Genital and aggenital setae (22‚Äì26) setiform, thin, slightly barbedÕæ anal and adanal setae (11) setiform, thin, roughened. Adanal lyrifissure located close
5 Œºm (b), 20 Œºm (c).
and slightly diagonal to anterior half of anal plate, posterior ad to 3 . Marginal porose area not observed.

Legs (
,
) ‚Äì Generally, typical for
Unguizetes
(e.g., Ermilov 2016 , 2017). Median claw distinctly thicker than lateral claws, all slightly barbed dorsallyÕæ each lateral claw with small tooth ventrodistally. Dorsoparaxial porose area on femora I‚ÄìIV, trochanters III, IV, ventrodistal porose area on tibia I‚ÄìIV and proximoventral porose area on tarsi I‚ÄìIV well visible. Formulas of leg setation and solenidia: I (1‚Äì5‚Äì3‚Äì4‚Äì20) [1‚Äì2‚Äì2], II (1‚Äì5‚Äì3‚Äì4‚Äì15) [1‚Äì1‚Äì2], III (2‚Äì3‚Äì1‚Äì3‚Äì15) [1‚Äì1‚Äì0], IV (1‚Äì2‚Äì2‚Äì3‚Äì12) [0‚Äì1‚Äì0]Õæ homology of setae and solenidia indicated in Table 1 .

Etymology ‚Äî The species is named in honor of Galina Gavrilovna Ershova, a worldrenowned Russian historian, anthropologist and epigrapher specializing in the study of the ancient civilizations, cultures, and languages of the New World. She is a disciple of Yu.V. Knorozov and currently continues to successfully develop his scientific ideas.

sec.title: Orphanage
Discussion
sec.p: , online version 2023) includes 10 genera and three subgenera in Mochlozetidae .

He considers the genus
Drymobatoides Jacot, 1936
, with additional subgenus
Rykella Balogh, 1962
as a representative of the family Drymobatidae and supported an independence of the subgenus
Unguizetes ( Calugarella ) Balogh and P. Balogh, 1992
.

The main family trait of Drymobatidae is the presence of both porose areas and saccules on the notogaster (see
Õæ
). The representatives of
Drymobatoides
have only porose areasÕæ therefore, we support the placement of the genus within Mochlozetidae . Also, earlier, we (
Õæ
) explained the reasons why we do not support subgeneric statuses of Calugarella and
Rykella
.

sec.title: Key to the known supraspecies taxa of Mochlozetidae
sec.p: 1. Posterior margin of notogaster triangularly narrowed or truncate........................2 ‚Äî Posterior margin of notogaster broadly rounded.......................................3

2. Posterior margin of notogaster triangularly narrowed......................................................................
Uracrobates ( Uracrobates ) Balogh and Mahunka, 1967
‚Äî Posterior margin of notogaster truncate...............................................

...............................
Uracrobates ( Parauracrobates ) Ermilov and Martens, 2015

3. All notogastral setae medium-sized, setiformÕæ dorsosejugal suture complete............. 4 ‚Äî All notogastral setae minute, needle-form or represented by alveoliÕæ dorsosejugal suture usually interrupted medially, rarely, complete........................................... 6

4. All or some notogastral porose areas shortly band-likeÕæ notogastral porose area
A 1
in dorsomedial positionÕæ translamella absent.........................
Nesiotizetes
.

‚Äî All notogastral porose areas rounded/ovalÕæ notogastral porose area
A 1
in lateroperipheral positionÕæ translamella present..........................................................5

5. Notogaster with 14 pairs of setae............
Gephyrazetes ( Gephyrazetes ) Hirauchi, 1999
‚Äî Notogaster with 10 pairs of setae.........
Gephyrazetes ( Oligogephyrazetes ) Sub√≠as, 2019
6. Notogaster with 20‚Äì50 pairs of minute porose areasÕæ dorsosejugal suture complete........
‚Äî Notogaster with less than 20 pairs of well-developed porose areasÕæ dorsosejugal suture usually interrupted medially, rarely, complete........................................... 7
7. Notogastral porose area Aa divided, represented by two areas.......................... 8 ‚Äî Notogastral porose area Aa not divided, represented by one area.......................11
8. Genital plate with five setaeÕæ all notogastral setae minute, needle-form.................. 9 ‚Äî Genital plate with six setaeÕæ all notogastral setae represented by alveoli................ 10

9. Translamella absentÕæ tutorium presentÕæ pteromorph developedÕæ notogaster usually with two pairs of posteroperipheral porose areas..........................
Mochlobates Norton, 1984

‚Äî Translamella presentÕæ tutorium absentÕæ pteromorph reducedÕæ notogaster usually with more than two pairs of posteroperipheral porose areas.............
Mochloribatula Mahunka, 1978

10. Both part of notogastral porose area Aa distant from each other, one part in dorsomedial position, the other part in lateroperipheral positionÕæ all notogastral porose areas rounded/oval..................................................
Mahunkazetes Balogh and Balogh, 1992
‚Äî Both part of notogastral porose area Aa located close to each other, in lateroperipheral positionÕæ all or some notogastral porose areas shortly band-like............................

11. Notogaster with five to eight pairs of porose areas, of them, three to six pairs in posteroperipheral positionÕæ translamella absent.........................
Dynatozetes Grandjean, 1960
‚Äî Notogaster with four pairs of porose areas, of them, two pairs A ( 2 , A3 ) in posteroperipheral positionÕæ translamella usually present, rarely, absent.................................... 12
12. Notogaster with 14 pairs of setaeÕæ dorsosejugal suture complete........................

.....................................................
Unguizetes ( Knorozovia )
n. subgen.
‚Äî Notogaster with 10 pairs of setaeÕæ dorsosejugal suture interrupted medially............. 13

13. Notogastral porose area
A 1
in dorsomedial position...................................

‚Äî Notogastral porose area
A 1
in lateroperipheral position.........
Podoribates Berlese, 1908

for SEM micrographs. This research was partially supported by the cooperative agreement No. FEWZ-2021-0004 from the Russian Ministry of Science and Higher Education.
